refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The &cmd; program manages service entries which are used by the globus-gatekeeper to execute services. Service entries are located in the /etc/grid-services directory. The &cmd; can list, enable, or disable specific services, or set a service as the default. The -h command-line option shows a brief usage message.

refsect2.title: Listing services
refsect2.para: The -l command-line option to &cmd; will cause it to list all of the services which are available to be run by the globus-gatekeeper. In the output, the service name will be followed by its status in brackets. Possible status strings are ENABLED, DISABLED, and ALIAS to NAME, where NAME is another service name.
If the -n NAME is used, then only information about the service named NAME is printed.

refsect2.title: Enabling services
refsect2.para: The -e SERVICE command-line option to &cmd; will cause it to enable a service so that it may be run by the globus-gatekeeper.
If the -n NAME option is used as well, then the service will be enabled with the alias NAME.

refsect2.title: Enabling a default service
refsect2.para: The -E command-line option to &cmd; will cause it to enable a service alias with the name jobmanager. The &cmd; program will choose the first service it finds as the default. To enable a particular service as the default, use the -e parameter described above with the -n parameter.

refsect2.title: Disabling services
refsect2.para: The -d SERVICE command-line option to &cmd; will cause it to disable a service so that it may not be run by the globus-gatekeeper. All aliases to a disabled service are also disabled.
